presentations.title: BASH for Control Freaks...Job Control Freaks
presentations.abstract:
BASH is a general-purpose tool.
Today we will look at:
Job Control: Running background jobs.
BASH processes can be managed as ‚Äújobs‚Äù.
Jobs can be:
Put in the background.
Brought to the foreground.
Stopped & Started.
Listed & Tracked.
Control Freaks Welcome

references.linkText: Job Control Basics - Bash Reference Manual

presentations.tweet: Join us on 10/09/2024 to dive into 'BASH for Control Freaks...Job Control Freaks' with Steven Lembark! Discover the power of managing BASH processes as jobs. Control freaks won't want to miss this! #BASH #JobControl @SLUUG_Org https://www.meetup.com/saint-louis-unix-users-group/events/300428327/

presentations.title: Improve cybersecurity with AI
presentations.abstract:
Save time with AI in your cybersecurity efforts...
How can we use AI for cybersecurity?
Use AI to improve on our cybersecurity defense, keep up with the challenges, what is the role of AI?
Use AI to enhance vulnerability assessments, and some predictions within our environment.
How can AI help in real-time monitoring and threat intelligence?
Help in incident response, behavioral analytics, phishing detection.
What are it's limitations, such as false positives?
Are there ethical considerations (privacy and data handling).
Finally discuss a bit of the future of AI in cybersecurity
Q&A with any time remaining.
presentations.tweet: Tony Zafiropoulos will unveil AI's magic in vulnerability assessments and incident response at our upcoming SLUUG session! Don't miss out on learning the future of cybersecurity. üåüüîç #AI #CyberSecurity @SLUUG_Org https://www.meetup.com/saint-louis-unix-users-group/events/300428327/

youtubeTitle: Mastering Job Control in BASH: Techniques for Control Freaks | SLUUG 2024-10-09

image.alt: Imagine an image that captures control and command within BASH. The background is a dimly lit yet sleek computer terminal screen in dark shades, representative of Unix/Linux environments at work. The Bash logo, a stylized 'B,' resides in the top left corner of the image. Surrounding the logo are petite symbols of 'play,' 'pause,' 'stop,' and 'list' - like you would see on media control panels. Along the bottom edge, silhouettes of gears and cogs subtly reside to depict control and management. There's a soft light trail that arcs through the icons and plunges into the background, illustrating the concept of seamless process flow and management. The color scheme contains predominantly black, green, and blue hues, reminiscent of classic terminal colors, and a soft glow around icons and edges for a modern touch.
